summary: This is an FBI affidavit by Task Force Officer Paul Byrne in support of an application for a search warrant to examine 27 electronic devices seized from Jeffrey Epstein's private island, Little Saint James, on August 12, 2019. The affidavit details the ongoing sex trafficking investigation, evidence found at Epstein's New York residence, and probable cause to believe the devices contain evidence of crimes. It includes the sealed indictment against Epstein and references multiple search warrants.

persons.name: Paul Byrne
persons.role: FBI Task Force Officer / NYPD Detective
persons.context: Affiant who authored the affidavit in support of the search warrant application. He is investigating sex trafficking and participated in searches and interviews.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The primary accused, charged with sex trafficking conspiracy and sex trafficking of minors. The affidavit details his alleged abuse of minors at multiple residences and his death in August 2019.

persons.name: Barbara Moses
persons.context: Signed the search warrants for Epstein's New York residence on July 6 and 7, 2019.

persons.name: Ruth Miller
persons.context: Signed the search warrant for the Virgin Islands Residence (Little Saint James) on August 11, 2019.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Signed the sealed indictment against Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Individual-1
persons.context: A woman who reported meeting Epstein at age 17, traveling to his properties, and being sexually abused and raped by him, including at the Virgin Islands Residence. She was photographed by a co-conspirator.

persons.name: Individual-2
persons.context: An individual who lived at the Virgin Islands Residence from 1999-2005/2006 and reported observing photographs of nude or partially nude young girls in the main residence.

persons.name: Victim-1
persons.context: A victim sexually abused by Epstein in New York between 2002-2005 while under 18. Provided detailed descriptions of the 'massage room' which were corroborated during the search.

connections.description: Epstein sexually abused and raped Individual-1 on multiple occasions when she was a minor, including at the Virgin Islands Residence.
Epstein sexually abused Victim-1 multiple times at his New York residence when she was under 18.
Employee-1, a New York-based employee, facilitated Epstein's abuse by contacting victims to schedule sexual encounters, as alleged in the indictment.
Employee-2, an assistant, facilitated abuse by scheduling encounters with minor victims in Florida, sometimes while in New York with Epstein.
Employee-3, an assistant, scheduled victims' encounters with Epstein and traveled frequently to the Virgin Islands Residence.
The affidavit references a co-conspirator (initials G.M.) who photographed victims at the Virgin Islands Residence and whose presence and potential involvement are part of the ongoing investigation.
Individual-1 reported that G.M. asked to photograph her and did photograph her at the Virgin Islands Residence when she was approximately 17.

events.title: Epstein Indictment
events.description: A grand jury in the Southern District of New York returned a sealed indictment charging Jeffrey Epstein with sex trafficking of minors and sex trafficking conspiracy.

events.title: Epstein Arrest and NY Residence Search
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested pursuant to the indictment. Law enforcement executed a search warrant at his New York residence, discovering a 'massage room' with sex toys and artwork, and numerous compact discs containing images of young girls.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York and pronounced dead.

events.title: Search of Little Saint James
events.description: Law enforcement executed a search warrant at Epstein's private island, Little Saint James in the U.S. Virgin Islands, and seized 27 electronic devices.

events.title: Period of Alleged Abuse
events.description: The indictment alleges Epstein sexually exploited dozens of minor girls at his residences in New York, Florida, and elsewhere during this period.

events.title: $250,000 Wire Transfer
events.description: Bank records show Epstein wired $250,000 from a trust account to a co-conspirator (G.M.) days after the Miami Herald published articles about his misconduct, suggesting an attempt to influence a potential witness.

locations: Little Saint James, U.S. Virgin Islands (Virgin Islands Residence)
New York, New York (New York Residence - Upper East Side mansion)
Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), New York, New York
Southern District of New York (court jurisdiction)
keyFacts: The affidavit seeks a warrant to forensically examine 27 electronic devices (computers, servers, a camera) seized from Epstein's private island, Little Saint James, on August 12, 2019.
A search of Epstein's New York residence in July 2019 uncovered a 'massage room' matching a victim's description from 2004, containing a massage table, sex toys, and artwork depicting nude females.

The New York search also yielded numerous compact discs containing thousands of nude or partially nude photographs of girls, many labeled with female names, 'LSJ' (Little Saint James), or 'Zorro' (Epstein's New Mexico ranch).
A victim (Individual-1) reported being sexually abused and raped by Epstein at the Virgin Islands Residence when she was 17 and being photographed there by Ghislaine Maxwell.
The investigation remained ongoing after Epstein's death, focusing on his co-conspirators, including employees who scheduled victim encounters and Ghislaine Maxwell.
